title: Account deactivated
content: If an account is deactivated, the user may have made too many login attempts with the wrong password.To change the number of authorized attempts before deactivating the account, refer to the section Change the number of failed authentification.Reactivate an accountOnly someone with Administrator rights can reactivate an account.If you are an Administrator, contact the support to reactivate.Access the employee file (Employees > Search),Select Mobile and Web Access,Click on the box beside Account is Active (just under the Password field),Save.Change the number of failed authentificationAccess the employee file,In the section Mobile and Web access > Modify Security Rules,Uncheck the Too many authentication failures will block the account box if you don't want block the account when someone tries to connect with the wrong passwordORCheck the Too many authentication failures will block the account box will block the user,Complete the boxes with the Maximum number of failed authentification before blocking the account,Click Save.You can apply it to all employees paid by the same company by selecting the appropriate one by clicking on Apply to all employees.NB: You further strengthen security with a password expiration period in day, and by applying different eligibility criteria for the password of your employees (number of MAX / MIN characters, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, special characters, numbers of digits.)Helpful?00Updated: 2 years ago Share :
